subject: Ethics
title: Deep Ecology vs Shallow Ecology
description: One-minute skill: Deep Ecology vs Shallow Ecology.

hook.text: Two environmentalists plant the same tree. One does it for oxygen. The other says the tree has rights.

buildup.text: Norwegian philosopher Arne NÃ¦ss split environmentalism into two camps in 1973: deep and shallow.

discovery.text: Shallow ecology protects nature because humans need it. Deep ecology says nature has value on its own.

twist.text: Deep ecologists argue that saving forests 'for clean air' still treats nature as a vending machine.

climax.text: The debate forces a question: do we protect nature for us, or does nature deserve protection period?

punchline.text: Same tree, two ethics. Your reason for planting matters.

quiz.question: What is the key difference between deep ecology and shallow ecology?
options: Shallow ecology protects nature for human benefit; deep ecology says nature has inherent value
Deep ecology focuses on oceans; shallow ecology focuses on land
Deep ecology only applies to endangered species
